column1: Cross-Relation Cross-Bag Attention for Distantly-Supervised Relation Extraction

column2: Liyuan Liu@University of Illinois at Urbana Champaign

column1: AAAI Technical Track: AI and the Web
Distant supervision leverages knowledge bases to automatically label instances
column2: thus allowing us to train relation extractor without human annotations. However
column3: the generated training data typically contain massive noise
column4: and may result in poor performances with the vanilla supervised learning. In this paper
column5: we propose to conduct multi-instance learning with a novel Cross-relation Cross-bag Selective Attention (C2SA)
column6: which leads to noise-robust training for distant supervised relation extractor. Specifically
column7: we employ the sentence-level selective attention to reduce the effect of noisy or mismatched sentences
column8: while the correlation among relations were captured to improve the quality of attention weights. Moreover
column9: instead of treating all entity-pairs equally
column10: we try to pay more attention to entity-pairs with a higher quality. Similarly
column11: we adopt the selective attention mechanism to achieve this goal. Experiments with two types of relation extractor demonstrate the superiority of the proposed approach over the state-of-the-art
column12: while further ablation studies verify our intuitions and demonstrate the effectiveness of our proposed two techniques.
